H0.text: Sexual reproduction generates most of the genetic variation that makes evolutionary adaptation possible.

H1.text: Cloning is the kind of reproduction that generates most of the genetic variation that makes evolutionary adaptation possible.

H2.text: Asexual reproduction generates most of the genetic variation that makes evolutionary adaptation possible.

H3.text: Synthetic reproduction is the kind of reproduction that generates most of the genetic variation that makes evolutionary adaptation possible.

A4.text: one definite advantage of sexual reproduction is that it increases genetic diversity and impedes the accumulation of harmful genetic mutations.

A5.text: Sexual selection is a mode of natural selection in which some individuals out-reproduce others of a population because they are better at securing mates for sexual reproduction. It has been described as 'a powerful evolutionary force that does not exist in asexual populations'.
